intro: Dasistoma virginica, commonly known as the Virginia dasistoma, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
